body_html:
The initializers namespace is preferred, and we are trying to avoid adding new symbols to the top-level tf module.

Eventually (probably with 2.0), tf.initializer will be deprecated in favor of tf.initializers..

The inconsistency is ugly, but if you switch to using tf.initializers, you don't ever have to see it.
body_text:
The initializers namespace is preferred, and we are trying to avoid adding new symbols to the top-level tf module.
Eventually (probably with 2.0), tf.initializer will be deprecated in favor of tf.initializers..
The inconsistency is ugly, but if you switch to using tf.initializers, you don't ever have to see it.
body:
The initializers namespace is preferred, and we are trying to avoid adding new symbols to the top-level tf module.

Eventually (probably with 2.0), tf.*initializer will be deprecated in favor of tf.initializers.*. 

The inconsistency is ugly, but if you switch to using tf.initializers, you don't ever have to see it.
